definition: Essen, city in the Ruhr 魯爾區|鲁尔区[Lu3 er3 Qu1], Germany
abbr. for Egypt 埃及[Ai1 ji2]

sentences.english: " Eisenman states categorically that he believes the James "artifact" is a forgery.
sentences.chinese: 埃森曼說他絕對地相信雅各“手工藝品”是一種僞造。

sentences.english: A similar demonstration against Jewish shops took place in Essen yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天在埃森也發生了同樣的圍堵猶太商場的示威運動。

sentences.english: Scientists are now studying the pea-sized meteorite which crashed to Earth in Essen, Germany.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們現在正在研究這片墜落在德國埃森的隕石。

sentences.english: Currently, Mr. Xu is a member of the Accenture Global Leadership Committee.
sentences.chinese: 徐乃洋先生目前是埃森哲全球領導委員會成員之一。

sentences.english: For example, a quarter of Accenture’s workforce is in India.
sentences.chinese: 四分之一的埃森哲諮詢公司員工在印度。

sentences.english: Raindrops on leaves in the park in Essen, Germany.
sentences.chinese: 德國，埃森，公園裏秋葉上的晶瑩雨珠。

sentences.english: Du Lun, director of the Office of Chinese Study, University—Essen.
sentences.chinese: 杜俞，博士，杜伊斯堡一埃森大學漢學研究室主任。

sentences.english: These works include the Jyvaskyla City Theatre and Essen Opera House.
sentences.chinese: 這些工程包括于韋斯屈萊市和埃森劇院歌劇院。

definition: Sachsen or Saxony, Bundesland in east of Germany, bordering on Poland and Czech republic, capital Dresden 德累斯頓|德累斯顿[De2 lei4 si1 dun4]
Württemberg, region of southwest Germany, former state around Stuttgart 斯圖加特|斯图加特[Si1 tu2 jia1 te4]
Werther, opera by Jules Massenet/Werther, German masculine given name
Dresden, capital of Saxony 薩克森州|萨克森州[Sa4 ke4 sen1 zhou1], Germany
